bibl.title: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 6, 1902

div1.p: Mabel Lazear thanks Sweitzer for a check. She writes about the children, but has not yet begun to receive her pension.

div1.head: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 6, 1902
div1.p:
Many
Many thanks for the
Babie's check as I call it.
It is always one of the
pleasantest things that happen
whom it was especially to me much
given to worrying about
money. I am so glad if
Houston talks so much
about you that now
Peggy often speaks about
Baltimore gammies She
says some of the little
nursery rhymes so cunning
When we start for the
back yard it sounds so
cunning to hear her say
“come on brodder”- she often
goes to him with a book
and says, “Read me tory”
Edith Pillsbury came out
here much to his joy- It
is such a pleasure to take
him againany where he is
so very good and enjoys
it all so- He always says
we will take Peggy when
she gets to be a big gal.
I did not know Nell when
she got off the train - she
looks like a wild aged
woman in the new
frock.- I think she looks
very well but is I think
very tired.-

(Pardon the spot- I was
drying this over the lamp)
you are away from that
dreadful heat- We have
been having unusually
good weather for San
Francisco so that the
Babies with their nurses
Mrs Lazear are out all
the time-

Nellie arrived on Wed-
nesday, we took Houston
over to Oakland to meet
to luncheon to-day- She
has been in town most
of the summer so that I
have seen more of her
than I do in the winter.

I think you asked once about
the Pension- Gen. Seth was
mistaken about it I receive
it from the time the Bill
was passed in the Senate.
I have not received it
yet but Mr Pillsbury
assures me I will in
the course of time.

About the night gowns.
Houston is still well off
in that respect but for
winter I have often thought
it would be fine if we
could make the kind
with feet. in I have really
never examined this
kind so I do not know
much about them but
having the legs and feet
would make them quite
warm.

This stupid letter must
end the nurse is so sleepy
Many, many thanks and
much love from the
Babies and
